pr_title: Convert geo field mappers to Parametrized form

timeline.message: Convert geo field mappers to Parametrized form

timeline.bodyText: This ended up catching a pre-existing bug in GeoShapeQueryTests, which was asking for TERM instead of term as a strategy, and therefore ending up falling back on null here, which was getting translated to recursive once the mapper had been parsed.  Silently falling back to recursive is a bug, I think, although on backport we will need to change this to emit a warning instead, as you can't change the strategy once it has been set and so existing mappings with badly-spelled term strategies will have to stay using recursive
timeline.author: romseygeek

replies.bodyText: Do you think this is a breaking change?
replies.author: iverase

replies.bodyText: I'd say it was a bugfix rather than a breaking change, I think?
replies.author: romseygeek

replies.bodyText: I opened #63975 to emit a deprecation warning for this case in 7.x
replies.author: romseygeek

replies.bodyText: Existing mappings sort of fix themselves, btw, so my above comment was not correct.  Once a user has added a mapping with a bad strategy, it will serialize itself as recursive, so we don't need to worry about parsing mappings from previous versions.
replies.author: romseygeek

replies.bodyText: Yes, that is what I checked so the only change is that creating a mapping will throw an error when before it was successful.
replies.author: iverase

timeline.bodyText: Whether or not a parameter has been explicitly set is of interest only to the mapper itself, and its serialization code; the PR changes these getters on the mappers to return simple booleans.
timeline.author: romseygeek

timeline.bodyText: These needed to be changed to getters, rather than just asserting in themselves, so that the checks for deprecated boost parameters didn't get confused by the additional warnings.
timeline.author: romseygeek

timeline.bodyText: It looks like the old code had a comment that this was intentionally a noop. I think it is worth keeping that.
timeline.author: nik9000

timeline.bodyText: We don't need to be equal to ParsedCartesianPoints?
timeline.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: If we're comparing against a ParsedCartesianPoint, then the earlier instanceof CartesianPoint branch will already have matched, so this branch is never called.
replies.author: romseygeek
